page.title: 11LOOKING,LISTENING,READING
page.content: Television is often blamed for its effect on society.Children are becoming less interested in reading because T.V. can supply sounds and pictures. Imaginations are becoming redundant. Almost every house has a TV many have video recorders.Viewing time is shared equally between BBC1 and ITV.News is more graphically shown on TV.Newspaper readership is in decline.In our area, 23% do not read a daily paper and 31% go without one on Sunday.The most popular papers are the tabloids,such as the Sun and News Of The World .Local papers hold a steady circulation totalling 28,000 per week despite the popularity of two free papers. Local radio has become more popular recently,with two stations to choose from.People seem to read less nowadays despite the fact that they have much more leisure time.
